alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 1:59PM CDT until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge and West Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas with water possibly over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding could begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Addis, Brusly, Merrydale, Brownfields, Westminster, Gardere, Inniswold, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson, Greenwell Spring, Erwinville and Baton Rouge Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
